solution_line_template: There are {bean_seedlings}/{bean_seedlings_per_row} = <<{bean_seedlings}/{bean_seedlings_per_row}={bean_rows}>>{bean_rows} rows of bean seedlings.
There are {pumpkin_seeds}/{pumpkin_seeds_per_row} = <<{pumpkin_seeds}/{pumpkin_seeds_per_row}={pumpkin_rows}>>{pumpkin_rows} rows of pumpkin seedlings.
Thus, there are a total of {bean_rows} + {pumpkin_rows} + {radish_rows} = <<{bean_rows}+{pumpkin_rows}+{radish_rows}={total_rows}>>{total_rows} rows of vegetables.
Therefore, the farmer had {total_rows}/{rows_per_plant_bed} = <<{total_rows}/{rows_per_plant_bed}={total_plant_beds}>>{total_plant_beds} plant beds.
